channel.title: Stuff.co.nz - Stuff
channel.description: Top Stories from Stuff.co.nz. New Zealand, world, sport, business & entertainment news on Stuff.co.nz.

item.title: PM Jacinda Ardern warns lockdowns will continue without more vaccination
item.description: A fresh outbreak of Covid-19 outside the Auckland border has brought a lockdown for Waikato and a warning for the rest of the country: Get vaccinated or face further restrictions.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS MANCH

item.title: Covid-19: How likely is level 2 for Auckland?
item.description: Experts are unsure the Government will risk dropping alert levels after new cases emerge south of Auckland's border.
item.dc:creator: AUCKLAND REPORTER

item.title: Covid-19: Much of the Waikato moves to level 3, alert level boundaries explained
item.description: Much of the Waikato will join Auckland at level 3 at midnight. The rest of NZ is at level 2. Here's what you need to know no matter where you are.
item.dc:creator: BRITTANY KEOGH

item.title: Covid-19: New Waikato location of interests added
item.description: New locations of interests in the region include McDonald's Taupiri, BP Raglan and Supervalue Raglan.
item.dc:creator: GERADEN CANN

item.title: Parts of Waikato to move to Level 3 after two new Covid-19 positive cases
item.description: Health Ministry says initial tests from household members of Covid-19 cases in Hamilton East and Palmerston North have returned negative results.
item.dc:creator: LAWRENCE GULLERY

item.title: Auckland seems set to remain in Covid-19 alert level 3 lockdown as the virus appears across the border in Waikato
item.description: Auckland appears set to remain in Covid-19 alert level 3 lockdown as the virus appears across the border in Waikato and throws the Government’s elimination strategy into question.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS MANCH

item.title: A Million Little Things: The contrived, melodramatic show that's truly addictive
item.description: REVIEW: This is Us might shade it in heartstring-pulling storylines, but this can’t be beaten for melodramatic moments and character crises per episode.
item.dc:creator: JAMES CROOT

item.title: Renee Zellweger's Case 39: One of the noughties' worst movies comes to Netflix
item.description: REVIEW: She looks miserable throughout, as will anyone who manages to last this near two hours of turgid, tiresome and downright torpid film-making.
item.dc:creator: JAMES CROOT

item.title: Diana: The Musical: Have Netflix just unleashed the worst musical in the world?
item.description: REVIEW: The music disappoints, and the lyrics are trite and obvious. This was The Crown as if Glee was let loose on it.
item.dc:creator: DAVE ARMSTRONG

item.title: Controversial weed killer's use cut back in Christchurch
item.description: The city council has long faced pressure to curtail its use of glyphosate. Records show it has cut down dramatically in the last two years.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN GUILDFORD

item.title: The Afghan war and the senseless terror of Western militarism
item.description: OPINION: If the Afghan disaster teaches us anything, it is that we have to end perpetual wars that only benefit the military oligarchs.
item.dc:creator: DONNA MILES

item.title: Tougher adventure tourism regs could give politicians power to shut down activities at risk from natural hazards
item.description: Cabinet and WorkSafe could get greater powers to close down adventure activities when natural hazards raise risk of multiple fatalities.
item.dc:creator: AMANDA CROPP

item.title: Covid-19: One-way travel bubble 'ours to lose', says RSE employer
item.description: It's all about “bubble integrity” across three key areas; live, travel and work.
item.dc:creator: MORGANE SOLIGNAC

item.title: 'So much fun': Coast to Coast founder spends lockdown writing a rock musical
item.description: Robin Judkins spent five years scribbling notes, lyrics and poems in a diary. The fruits of his labour should, hopefully, debut on stage this month.
item.dc:creator: CHARLIE GATES

item.title: Three year, four designs, $200,000 in fees: one family's dream home battle
item.description: Three years, four designs and $200,000 on professional fees. Matthew Beaven just wanted to build a home, and says it should never have come to this.
item.dc:creator: TINA LAW

item.title: Fantail evolution affected by urbanisation
item.description: Their bills are getting shorter, deeper and wider.
item.dc:creator: WILL HARVIE

item.title: Rookie right backs get chance to stake All Whites claims in troublesome position
item.description: Niko Kirwan and Kelvin Kalua are at different stages of their European football journeys, but they have the same opportunity over the next fortnight.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW VOERMAN

item.title: First Rung - Reno 101: Are you ready for a DIY project, and can you afford it?
item.description: Homed's podcast about buying a first home dives into the dirty, dusty, satisfying world of home renovations.
item.dc:creator: KYLIE KLEIN-NIXON

item.title: All Blacks v South Africa: 'That one will hurt' says ABs coach Ian Foster
item.description: Why did the All Blacks lose to the Springboks? A bloated penalty count and a shaky lineout were major issues. Among other things.
item.dc:creator: RICHARD KNOWLER

item.title: Nectar factory key to mānuka honey's great value
item.description: Jars of rare honey can sell for $2500 – or $10 a gram. Yikes.
item.dc:creator: PETER GRIFFIN
